Description: Lamp for a stand; brass; circular body, flat at the top, and long neck with crescent-shaped indentations at the sides; openwork lyre-shaped handle, the top part of which is broken and missing; the hinged circular cover of the hole for filling has a projecting tongue prolonged almost to the spout; upper part of handle missing.
Bibliographic references: Dalton 1901 / Catalogue of Early Christian Antiquities and Objects from the Christian East in the Department of British and Medieval Antiquities and Ethnography of the British Museum (506)
Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3794MLA)
Xanthopoulou 2010 / Les lampes en bronze à l’époque paléochrétienne (LA 6.037)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
